Is a binational park with Darien National Park in Panama, was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO, it is part of the named Darien Gap. It is rich in flora and fauna, found in various animal species such as manatees, tapirs, tigers, otters, some of them in danger of extinction. They are also a variety of birds and fish.
The Park offers lodging, meals and guides. You can visit it: The Jumping Filupo, Fendal and La Tigra, The Marshes Cacarica and Tumaradó.
Natural sanctuary for birds migration from South and North America, natural oyster.
Site for those who like the typical dishes of seafood and river prepared by fishermen who live there.
